about.summary: Extensive functions for L-moments (LMs) and probability-weighted moments (PWMs), parameter estimation for distributions, LM computation for distributions, and L-moment ratio diagrams. Maximum likelihood and maximum product of spacings estimation are also available. LMs for right-tail and left-tail censoring by known or unknown threshold and by indicator variable are available. Asymmetric (asy) trimmed LMs (TL-moments, TLMs) are supported. LMs of residual (resid) and reversed (rev) resid life are implemented along with 13 quantile function operators for reliability and survival analyses. Exact analytical bootstrap estimates of order statistics, LMs, and variances- covariances of LMs are provided. The Harri-Coble Tau34-squared Normality Test is available. Distribution support with "L" (LMs), "TL" (TLMs) and added (+) support for right-tail censoring (RC) encompasses: Asy Exponential (Exp) Power [L], Asy Triangular [L], Cauchy [TL], Eta-Mu [L], Exp. [L], Gamma [L], Generalized (Gen) Exp Poisson [L], Gen Extreme Value [L], Gen Lambda [L,TL], Gen Logistic [L), Gen Normal [L], Gen Pareto [L+RC, TL], Govindarajulu [L], Gumbel [L], Kappa [L], Kappa-Mu [L], Kumaraswamy [L], Laplace [L], Linear Mean Resid. Quantile Function [L], Normal [L], 3-p log-Normal [L], Pearson Type III [L], Rayleigh [L], Rev-Gumbel [L+RC], Rice/Rician [L], Slash [TL], 3-p Student t [L], Truncated Exponential [L], Wakeby [L], and Weibull [L]. Multivariate sample L-comoments (LCMs) are implemented to measure asymmetric associations.

Asymmetric (asy) trimmed LMs (TL-moments, TLMs) are supported. LMs of residual (resid) and reversed (rev) resid life are implemented along with 13 quantile function operators for reliability and survival analyses. Exact analytical bootstrap estimates of order statistics, LMs, and variances- covariances of LMs are provided. The Harri-Coble Tau34-squared Normality Test is available. Distribution support with "L" (LMs), "TL" (TLMs) and added (+) support for right-tail censoring (RC) encompasses: Asy Exponential (Exp) Power [L], Asy Triangular [L], Cauchy [TL], Eta-Mu [L], Exp. [L], Gamma [L], Generalized (Gen) Exp Poisson [L], Gen Extreme Value [L], Gen Lambda [L,TL], Gen Logistic [L), Gen Normal [L], Gen Pareto [L+RC, TL], Govindarajulu [L], Gumbel [L], Kappa [L], Kappa-Mu [L], Kumaraswamy [L], Laplace [L], Linear Mean Resid. Quantile Function [L], Normal [L], 3-p log-Normal [L], Pearson Type III [L], Rayleigh [L], Rev-Gumbel [L+RC], Rice/Rician [L], Slash [TL], 3-p Student t [L], Truncated Exponential [L], Wakeby [L], and Weibull [L]. Multivariate sample L-comoments (LCMs) are implemented to measure asymmetric associations.

name: r-lmomco
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set version = "2.5.1" %}
{% set posix = 'm2-' if win else '' %}

package:
  name: r-lmomco
  version: {{ version|replace("-", "_") }}

source:
  url:
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/lmomco_{{ version }}.tar.gz
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/Archive/lmomco/lmomco_{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: 647d980fb853e1f059a305c36aa02842226fd4051300ce1c0fabc7ad58a9784a

build:
  number: 2
  noarch: generic
  rpaths:
    - lib/R/lib/
    - lib/

requirements:
  build:
    - {{ posix }}zip               # [win]
    - cross-r-base {{ r_base }}    # [build_platform != target_platform]
  host:
    - r-base
    - r-lmoments
    - r-mass
    - r-goftest
  run:
    - r-base
    - r-lmoments
    - r-mass
    - r-goftest

test:
  commands:
    - $R -e "library('lmomco')"           # [not win]
    - "\"%R%\" -e \"library('lmomco')\""  # [win]

about:
  home: http://www.amazon.com/dp/1463508417/
  license: GPL-2.0-or-later
  summary: 'Extensive functions for L-moments (LMs) and probability-weighted moments (PWMs), parameter estimation for distributions, LM computation for distributions, and L-moment ratio diagrams. Maximum likelihood and maximum product of spacings estimation are also available. LMs for right-tail and left-tail censoring by
    known or unknown threshold and by indicator variable are available. Asymmetric (asy) trimmed LMs (TL-moments, TLMs) are supported. LMs of residual (resid) and reversed (rev) resid life are implemented along with 13 quantile function operators for reliability and survival analyses. Exact analytical bootstrap estimates
    of order statistics, LMs, and variances- covariances of LMs are provided. The Harri-Coble Tau34-squared Normality Test is available. Distribution support with "L" (LMs), "TL" (TLMs) and added (+) support for right-tail censoring (RC) encompasses: Asy Exponential (Exp) Power [L], Asy Triangular [L], Cauchy [TL], Eta-Mu
    [L], Exp. [L], Gamma [L], Generalized (Gen) Exp Poisson [L], Gen Extreme Value [L], Gen Lambda [L,TL], Gen Logistic [L), Gen Normal [L], Gen Pareto [L+RC, TL], Govindarajulu [L], Gumbel [L], Kappa [L], Kappa-Mu [L], Kumaraswamy [L], Laplace [L], Linear Mean Resid. Quantile Function [L], Normal [L], 3-p log-Normal [L],
    Pearson Type III [L], Rayleigh [L], Rev-Gumbel [L+RC], Rice/Rician [L], Slash [TL], 3-p Student t [L], Truncated Exponential [L], Wakeby [L], and Weibull [L]. Multivariate sample L-comoments (LCMs) are implemented to measure asymmetric associations.'
  license_family: GPL3
  license_file:
    - {{ environ["PREFIX"] }}/lib/R/share/licenses/GPL-3

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - conda-forge/r
    - cofinoa


# Package: lmomco
# Type: Package
# Title: L-Moments, Censored L-Moments, Trimmed L-Moments, L-Comoments, and Many Distributions
# Version: 2.3.6
# Depends: R (>= 2.10.0), utils
# Imports: goftest, Lmoments, MASS
# Suggests: copBasic
# Date: 2020-03-14
# Author: William Asquith
# Description: Extensive functions for L-moments (LMs) and probability-weighted moments (PWMs), parameter estimation for distributions, LM computation for distributions, and L-moment ratio diagrams. Maximum likelihood and maximum product of spacings estimation are also available. LMs for right-tail and left-tail censoring by known or unknown threshold and by indicator variable are available. Asymmetric (asy) trimmed LMs (TL-moments, TLMs) are supported. LMs of residual (resid) and reversed (rev) resid life are implemented along with 13 quantile function operators for reliability and survival analyses. Exact analytical bootstrap estimates of order statistics, LMs, and variances- covariances of LMs are provided. The Harri-Coble Tau34-squared Normality Test is available. Distribution support with "L" (LMs), "TL" (TLMs) and added (+) support for right-tail censoring (RC) encompasses: Asy Exponential (Exp) Power [L], Asy Triangular [L], Cauchy [TL], Eta-Mu [L], Exp. [L], Gamma [L], Generalized (Gen) Exp Poisson [L], Gen Extreme Value [L], Gen Lambda [L,TL], Gen Logistic [L), Gen Normal [L], Gen Pareto [L+RC, TL], Govindarajulu [L], Gumbel [L], Kappa [L], Kappa-Mu [L], Kumaraswamy [L], Laplace [L], Linear Mean Resid. Quantile Function [L], Normal [L], 3-p log-Normal [L], Pearson Type III [L], Rayleigh [L], Rev-Gumbel [L+RC], Rice/Rician [L], Slash [TL], 3-p Student t [L], Truncated Exponential [L], Wakeby [L], and Weibull [L]. Multivariate sample L-comoments (LCMs) are implemented to measure asymmetric associations.
# Maintainer: William Asquith <william.asquith@ttu.edu>
# Repository: CRAN
# License: GPL
# URL: http://www.amazon.com/dp/1463508417/
# NeedsCompilation: no
# LazyData: true
# Packaged: 2020-03-14 14:25:38 UTC; wasquith
# Date/Publication: 2020-03-14 15:00:02 UTC
